text: Acleris cornana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Alberta, British Columbia, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maine, Manitoba, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, New Brunswick, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Ontario, Quebec, Vermont, Washington and Wisconsin.mothphotographersgroup The wingspan is 14–16 mm. The forewings are uniform olive grey.McDunnough, J. 1934. The Canadian species of the Tortricid genus Peronea. Canadian Journal of Research, 1934, 11(3): 290-332 Adults have been recorded on wing from March to November. The larvae feed on Alnus incana and Cornus species (including Cornus canadensis, Cornus racemosa and Cornus sericea).Tortricidae Food Plant Database ==References== Category:Moths described in 1933 cornana Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris cornana
